net.sf.sanity4j.util
Class ExtractStats

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.sanity4j.util.ExtractStats

public final class ExtractStats
extends Object

Utility class for extracting statistics from the various tool's XML outputs. Since many of the tools use different versions of paths (e.g. short file names on win32), the canonical path must be used when referring to any path.

Since:
Sanity4J 1.0
Author:
Yiannis Paschalidis

getCanonicalPath

public String getCanonicalPath(String path)
                        throws IOException
Returns the canonical (unique) version of the given path. See File.getCanonicalPath().

Parameters:
path - the path
Returns:
the canonical version of the path
Throws:

getClassNameForSourcePath

public String getClassNameForSourcePath(String sourcePath)
Returns the class name for the given source path.

Parameters:
sourcePath - the source path
Returns:
the class name, or "unknown" if not a class

getPackageName

public String getPackageName(String sourceFilePath)
Determines the "correct" package name for a java source file, given its full path. The path is assumed to be inside getSourceDirectory() .

Parameters:
sourceFilePath - the full path to the source file
Returns:
the package name for the given source file.
